course_title: Advanced Topics in Linguistics: Big/Small Data & Visualization
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 2 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as SOC 489W 1, QTM 490RW 1)
SOC/LING/QTM 446W as prerequisite


The course is a sequel to Soc/Ling/QTM 446W. You will need permission to register and must have 446W as prerequisite. It aims to bring to a co-authored journal submission the work carried out by students in 446W on different text corpora. The course is an intensive 4-credits analytic and writing course that fulfills the writing requirement. As a result of the W, we need to make sure to carry out, even if in small teams, a great deal of bi-weekly writing.
Students will work in teams, one team per corpus. Teams will be expected to present their work, as a team, every two weeks throughout the semester and present four co-authored drafts of their ongoing work at regular intervals. We should all read and comment each other's drafts.
Final paper and literature review
Since the final paper is expected to be submitted to a journal, the literature review part of the paper will engage both appropriate NLP literature and specific topic literature as appropriate for the corpus (thus, a corpus of country folktales will need to address the literature on folktales).
The projects
Students' teams have been working on following corpora.
1.	Cross-national folktales
2.	New York Times book reviews
3.	POTUS speeches
4.	Harry Potter books
5.	HIV personal narratives from Africa
6.	Gay men personal narratives
7.	Corpus collected by a team
course_description: Investigation of a particular issue or topic in the study of language, linguistics, and communication on an advanced level. May be repeated when topic varies.
